title: Patch 6.17 issue not resolved?
body:
Hi Riot,

I am trying to start up my client but it keeps stopping at random moments, telling me to go check my logs.
I have done some research on the boards regarding this issue and there is a post that claims the issue is resolved, but I keep getting booted out of updating. Even the fabled "Continue" button is nowhere to be seen, when it fails, my options are "retry" or x out.

I tried running as admin, I tried turning my computer off and on again. Nothing seems to work.

Also, side note. While reading comments, a Rioter seems to imply there are percentages other than 33% while updating, this has never been the case for me. The moment the patcher starts up, it goes straight to 33%, on days where the patcher works, it will eventually jump from 33% to 99% to 100%. There is no 0%, nothing between 0 and 33%, nothing between 33 and 99%. This has never changed in my history of League of Legends. Is this normal?

Help please.

Update: I x'ed out of the error message and the files being scanned are not being reset, it freezes at 116 files scanned but it slows my entire computer to a halt, even slowing down my inputs in a text document. Had to stop attempting to patch.

Please contact if there's a fix.

replies.body:
While the symptoms you have might be related to last night's issue, it doesn't necessarily mean that it's the same problem.  When you close out the patcher while it's processing, it needs to scan all of your game files for corruption.  This has to be done before it can even consider applying a patch update.  It's absolutely important that you let it finish scanning your files, as it will be the only means of getting to the next phase.  Do not close the patcher.  

If you are getting an unspecified error at 33% or higher, then your network might actually have a problem connecting to the patching server.  Should it happen again, your best bet would be to follow the steps in our [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to get this fixed up.  Patience is key, let the patcher do its thing!

I reloaded the patcher and have left it running since you posted.
It went up to 207 files scanned but has not moved since. It went up to 207 maybe 5 minutes after x'ing out of the error message.
It is still at 207 files.

Will update in an hour or so.

Dear Sir Rito Person, Whenever this error occurs, it slows my computer down to the point where I have to either shut the patcher down, or my computer completely freezes. The error came up every 45 files scanned ( approx. ) where at about 512 files my computer itself just shut down.
